body_html:
@girving
we have to check the collision before sending data to GPU given the the collision requirements.
So I wanna divide into two cases:

  1. No collision: easy to use threadIdx/blockIdx to index. (most time).
  2. Collison: compute all the output's indies at CPU to resolve the collision, then send to GPU.

Welcome any tips.

body:
@girving
we have to check the collision before sending data to GPU given the  the collision requirements.  
So I wanna divide into two cases:

1. No collision: easy to use threadIdx/blockIdx to index. (most time).
2. Collison: compute all the output's indies at CPU to resolve the collision, then send to GPU.

Welcome any tips.
